title: (x) 'happy holidays' typeface or hand-drawn? - custom by Jessica Hische, various alternatives {Florian, Rainer}
content:
I am trying to determine if this is a typeface or if it is completely custom. I am looking for a script as similar as possible so if anyone can recommend something it would be greatly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 66.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202120522/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2066.jpg) | 62.79 KB |
author: Michael Danskin

comments.content: Itâ€™s clever, nice and custom. Have a closer look at the details of the repeating characters, they are all different.

To mimick this beauty with actual typefaces is difficult. Try [Sneaker Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202120522/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/sneaker-script/) or [Giddyup](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202120522/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/giddyup/) for more rope-like fonts.
Yeah I had a feeling it was custom. Sneaker Script looks like a nice staring point in executing something along those lines. Thanks!
